enWisdom: Seclusion is the best (or the fortification of) piety
Seclusion is the best trait of the sagacious

Wisdom: إِذَا رَأَيْتَ اللَّهَ يُؤْنِسُكَ بِخَلْقِهِ وَيُوحِشُكَ مِنْ ذِكْرِهِ فَقَدْ أَبْغَضَكَ
enWisdom: When you see that Allah is making you comfortable with His creation and isolating you from His remembrance, then [know that] He dislikes you

Wisdom: فِي الِانْفِرَادِ لِعِبَادَةِ اللَّهِ كُنُوزُ الْأَرْبَاحِ
enWisdom: In secluding oneself for the worship of Allah there are treasures of benefit

Wisdom: فِي اعْتِزَالِ أَبْنَاءِ الدُّنْيَا جِمَاعُ الصَّلَاحِ
enWisdom: In seclusion from the worldly people there is accumulation of goodness
Whoever believes in one God is saved

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَأْنَسُ بِاللَّهِ مَنْ لَا يَسْتَوْحِشُ مِنَ الْخَلْقِ
enWisdom: How can one become intimate with Allah when he has not separated himself from the creation?
One who tests [the people who love this world] secludes himself [from them]
One who secludes himself, his indifference towards the pleasures of this world becomes strong
One who knows [the true nature of] the people, isolates himself
Remaining in seclusion [when it is required to safeguard faith] is the habit of the righteous

Wisdom: مُدَاوَمَةُ الْوَحْدَةِ أَسْلَمُ مِنْ خُلْطَةِ النَّاسِ
enWisdom: Continuous solitude is safer than mingling with the people
How good a worship seclusion is!
Safety is in solitude
Solitude is the comfort of the worshippers
Verily in anonymity [and lack of fame and prominence] there is peace of mind
The safety of religion is in seclusion from the people

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْخُلْطَةِ [الخطة] تَصُونُ الدِّينَ وَتُرِيحُ مِنْ مُقَارَبَةِ الْأَشْرَارِ
enWisdom: Reduced mingling preserves religion and relieves one from having to associate with wicked people

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْمَعَارِفِ مِحْنَةٌ وَخُلْطَةُ النَّاسِ فِتْنَةٌ
enWisdom: Having many acquaintances is a tribulation, and socializing with the people is an ordeal
One who secludes [from the people] himself remains safe
Whoever secludes himself, his piety remains safeguarded?

Wisdom: مَنِ اعْتَزَلَ النَّاسَ سَلِمَ مِنْ شَرِّهِمْ
enWisdom: One who secludes himself from the people is safe from their evil
One who isolates himself is spared from sorrows

Wisdom: مَنِ انْفَرَدَ عَنِ النَّاسِ أَنِسَ بِاللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: One who isolates himself from the people becomes intimate with Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: مَنِ انْفَرَدَ عَنِ النَّاسِ صَانَ دِينَهُ
enWisdom: One who isolates himself from the people preserves his religion

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ أَرَادَ صَلَاحَ نَفْسِهِ وَإِحْرَازَ دِينِهِ أَنْ يَجْتَنِبَ مُخَالَطَةَ أَبْنَاءِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: It behoves the one who wants to reform himself and protect his religion to avoid mingling with people who seek [the wealth and pleasures of] this world
